<Link id="l00024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="24"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="25"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This is an important base class in LLVM. It provides the common facilities</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><Highlight kind="comment">/// of all constant values in an LLVM program. A constant is a value that is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><Highlight kind="comment">/// immutable at runtime. Functions are constants because their address is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><Highlight kind="comment">/// immutable. Same with global variables.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><Highlight kind="comment">/// All constants share the capabilities provided in this class. All constants</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><Highlight kind="comment">/// can have a null value. They can have an operand list. Constants can be</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><Highlight kind="comment">/// simple (integer and floating point values), complex (arrays and structures),</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33"><Highlight kind="comment">/// or expression based (computations yielding a constant value composed of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><Highlight kind="comment">/// only certain operators and other constant values).</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Note that Constants are immutable (once created they never change)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><Highlight kind="comment">/// and are fully shared by structural equivalence.  This means that two</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><Highlight kind="comment">/// structurally equivalent constants will always have the same address.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Constants are created on demand as needed and never deleted: thus clients</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><Highlight kind="comment">/// don&#39;t have to worry about the lifetime of the objects.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><Highlight kind="comment">/// LLVM Constant Representation</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constant"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constant/#a6659b3192e82624cd45d835e9178f8f7">Constant</a> : </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">public</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/user/#a282fa3e9586425313e0a954c18deee15">User</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">protected</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constant/#a6659b3192e82624cd45d835e9178f8f7"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constant/#a6659b3192e82624cd45d835e9178f8f7">Constant</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42;ty, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value/#af6d11b38374c4f9e6ba3a6407da2dee0">ValueTy</a> vty, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/user/allocinfo">AllocInfo</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/user/allocinfo">AllocInfo</a>)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><Highlight kind="normal">      : <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/user/#a282fa3e9586425313e0a954c18deee15">User</a>(ty, vty, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/user/allocinfo">AllocInfo</a>) &#123;&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">public</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constant/#a20b6ec414d8e3ad6cfae7313d4ef64a7"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constant/#a20b6ec414d8e3ad6cfae7313d4ef64a7">operator=</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constant/#a6659b3192e82624cd45d835e9178f8f7">Constant</a> &amp;) = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">delete</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="100"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// This is identical to just comparing the pointers, with the exception that</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// for vectors, if only one of the constants has an &#96;undef&#96; element in some</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="108"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// entire vector is undef or poison.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00175" /><CodeLine lineNumber="175"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00176" /><CodeLine lineNumber="176"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00177" /><CodeLine lineNumber="177"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// This method is a special form of User::replaceUsesOfWith</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00178" /><CodeLine lineNumber="178"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// (which does not work on constants) that does work</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00179" /><CodeLine lineNumber="179"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// on constants.  Basically this method goes through the trouble of building</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00180" /><CodeLine lineNumber="180"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// a new constant that is equivalent to the current one, with all uses of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00181" /><CodeLine lineNumber="181"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// From replaced with uses of To.  After this construction is completed, all</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00182" /><CodeLine lineNumber="182"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// of the users of &#39;this&#39; are replaced to use the new constant, and then</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00183" /><CodeLine lineNumber="183"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// &#39;this&#39; is deleted.  In general, you should not call this method, instead,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00184" /><CodeLine lineNumber="184"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// use Value::replaceAllUsesWith, which automatically dispatches to this</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00185" /><CodeLine lineNumber="185"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// method as needed.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00186" /><CodeLine lineNumber="186"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00187" /><CodeLine lineNumber="187"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constant/#afb784171b976ddd992e3f27ac36a894d">handleOperandChange</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00188" /><CodeLine lineNumber="188"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00230" /><CodeLine lineNumber="230"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00231" /><CodeLine lineNumber="231"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Merges undefs of a Constant with another Constant, along with the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00232" /><CodeLine lineNumber="232"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// undefs already present. Other doesn&#39;t have to be the same type as C, but</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00233" /><CodeLine lineNumber="233"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// both must either be scalars or vectors with the same element count. If no</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00234" /><CodeLine lineNumber="234"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// changes are made, the constant C is returned.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00235" /><CodeLine lineNumber="235"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constant">Constant</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constant/#a31dbd9cf336966a863e37c5653b6c134">mergeUndefsWith</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constant">Constant</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4cafd841a49aec1539bc88abc8ff9e170fb">C</a>, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constant">Constant</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a9eb4f5b98b70ee4fab9614ed58282c1fa6311ae17c1ee52b36e68aaf4ad066387">Other</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00236" /><CodeLine lineNumber="236"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00237" /><CodeLine lineNumber="237"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Return true if a constant is ConstantData or a ConstantAggregate or</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00238" /><CodeLine lineNumber="238"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// ConstantExpr that contain only ConstantData.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00239" /><CodeLine lineNumber="239"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constant/#a5a4d3145c046afe97789b9739a200971">isManifestConstant</a>() </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00240" /><CodeLine lineNumber="240"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00241" /><CodeLine lineNumber="241"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">private</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00242" /><CodeLine lineNumber="242"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">enum</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> PossibleRelocationsTy &#123;</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00243" /><CodeLine lineNumber="243"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// This constant requires no relocations. That is, it holds simple</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00244" /><CodeLine lineNumber="244"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// constants (like integrals).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00245" /><CodeLine lineNumber="245"><Highlight kind="normal">    NoRelocation = 0,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00246" /><CodeLine lineNumber="246"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00247" /><CodeLine lineNumber="247"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// This constant holds static relocations that can be resolved by the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00248" /><CodeLine lineNumber="248"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// static linker.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00249" /><CodeLine lineNumber="249"><Highlight kind="normal">    LocalRelocation = 1,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00250" /><CodeLine lineNumber="250"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00251" /><CodeLine lineNumber="251"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// This constant holds dynamic relocations that the dynamic linker will</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00252" /><CodeLine lineNumber="252"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// need to resolve.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00253" /><CodeLine lineNumber="253"><Highlight kind="normal">    GlobalRelocation = 2,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00254" /><CodeLine lineNumber="254"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00255" /><CodeLine lineNumber="255"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
